title: The 'Carpet Court' Blueprint
author: adam-harrington
description: Master your pivots, jabs, and defensive stance without a hoop or hard floor. Carpet increases friction and forces stability—making it perfect for footwork drills.
coachNote: Adam's Take: Kobe Bryant spent hours without a ball just perfecting his pivot. On carpet, you can feel your balance better because the surface forces your feet to work. Master the 'Drop' and the 'Rip' before you ever pick up a ball.

steps.title: Drop Stance Holds
steps.instruction: Drop into a wide athletic base. Feet wider than shoulders, chest up, weight on balls of feet. Hold for 10 seconds. Reset and repeat.

steps.title: Jab Step Series
steps.instruction: From triple threat position, execute a violent jab step. Don't move your pivot foot. Sell the drive with your eyes and shoulder. Alternate feet.

steps.title: Pivot Drills (Front)
steps.instruction: Plant your right foot as pivot. Step forward with left, then sweep back. 10 reps each direction. Keep pivot foot glued to the ground.

steps.title: Pivot Drills (Reverse)
steps.instruction: Plant your right foot as pivot. Step back with left in a reverse pivot, then forward. 10 reps each direction. Feel the hip rotation.

steps.title: Defensive Slides
steps.instruction: Stay low in defensive stance. Slide 3 steps right, 3 steps left. Never let your feet come together. Stay on the balls of your feet.

coachingCues: The carpet should 'grab' your feet—that's the point
Never stand up during transitions—stay in athletic stance
Your pivot foot should never move even 1 millimeter
Eyes up, chest up, butt down
commonMistake: Standing up between reps and losing the athletic base
mistakeFix: Pretend there's a ceiling 6 inches above your head that you can't touch
